intro: Zygogynum semecarpoides var. whiteanum, commonly known as the Whiteanum Zygogynum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
